summary: The work spans multiple initiatives including OTP (One-Time Purchase) product implementation with voucher systems and checkout modifications, test infrastructure improvements through quarantine systems, and strategic planning for GreenChef NL migration and marketplace features. The team is actively working on e-commerce funnel optimization, payment flows, and SEO planning while maintaining several open epics for future development.

decisions.what: Skip PCS (Pre-Checkout Selection) API call for OTP products
decisions.rationale: OTP products use a different cart creation flow and don't need the PCS call, which is designed for subscription products. This prevents unnecessary API calls.

decisions.what: Update discount banner copy to emphasize subscription benefits over one-time boxes
decisions.rationale: To emphasize the benefits of having a subscription vs one-time box
Test had 2.00% success rate (157 failures out of 160 runs), preventing flaky tests from blocking pipeline

decisions.what: Correct FFL voucher display to show % sign instead of $ sign for percentage-based discounts
decisions.rationale: Ensure accurate representation of percentage-based discounts for FFL vouchers

initiatives.name: OTP (One-Time Purchase) Product Implementation
initiatives.description: Enable one-time purchase products with proper checkout flow, voucher system, and payment integration separate from subscription products

initiatives.name: Price/Menu Experimentation
initiatives.description: POC to validate complexity and feasibility of price and menu experimentation capabilities

initiatives.name: GreenChef NL Customer Migration
initiatives.description: Discovery and planning for migrating active GreenChef NL customers, including process documentation and execution planning

initiatives.name: TAM BE Services Handover & Deprecation
initiatives.description: Handover and deprecation of TAM backend services

initiatives.name: Second-Party Recipe Marketplace
initiatives.description: Development of marketplace for second-party recipes

initiatives.name: SEO and Website Re-direction
initiatives.description: Planning and documentation for SEO strategy and website redirection execution

initiatives.name: Variable & Itemized Pricing
initiatives.description: Implementation of variable and itemized pricing capabilities

initiatives.name: Manage Week Improvements
initiatives.description: Enhancements to week management including multi-address and seamless experience

initiatives.name: Occasion Box Rollout
initiatives.description: Launch of occasion boxes for HF CA and HF ANZ markets

entities.name: OTP (One-Time Purchase)
entities.context: New product type requiring separate cart creation flow and checkout modifications

technical_patterns.pattern: Conditional API call skipping based on product type
technical_patterns.context: OTP products bypass PCS API calls since they use different cart creation flow than subscriptions, reducing unnecessary API overhead

technical_patterns.pattern: Test quarantine system for flaky tests
technical_patterns.context: Automated system to prevent tests with low success rates from blocking CI/CD pipeline, improving development velocity

technical_patterns.pattern: Feature flag rollout for production releases
technical_patterns.context: OTP feature requires feature flag rollout coordination as part of production release process
Different banner copy shown based on experiment variation membership for A/B testing
Price/menu experimentation validated through POC including OTP Seamless SKU creation and menu item testing

technical_patterns.pattern: Currency symbol detection for voucher display
technical_patterns.context: System needs to correctly detect and display percentage vs dollar signs for different voucher types

dependencies.context: OTP launch requires feature flag rollout to production as part of release process
Payment page conditionally depends on PCS API based on product type (subscription vs OTP)
Banner copy variations depend on experiment membership status
Pipeline execution depends on quarantine system to filter out flaky tests
Customer migration requires coordinated SEO and website redirection strategy
